cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves happen every year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 16.6mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded today ranking 2nd in our overall records.  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of rain fell.  On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.
Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 10 days and counting started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (195°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.52 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.1 mm), feels like temperature (up 2.4°C), cloud levels (up 986 m), and outside temperature (up 1.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 505.2m higher than yesterday, 100.1m higher than the past week, 986.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1615.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1515.6m and 2600m.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Periods of rain anticipated, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright sunshine will dominate the day. Weather could become unsettled.
